citations.narrative:
The three outdoor areas of the sheltered housing facility for five adult cats have an overgrowth of weeds throughout the
areas. The weeds are tall and thick enough to make it difficult to see the cats when they walk through the area.
Overgrowth of weeds may obscure the outdoor surfaces making it difficult to identify areas that need to be cleaned and
may allow harborage for insects and pests. Housing facilities must be free of any accumulation of trash, waste material,
junk, weeds, and other discarded material. To be corrected by June 13, 2025.

A primary enclosure containing two kangaroos, and two wallabies is not enclosed with a perimeter fence. A perimeter
fence is essential for restricting contact between exotic animals and unauthorized people or animals. A perimeter fence
also acts as a secondary containment system in the event an animal escapes from the primary enclosure. The licensee
must provide a perimeter fence that is of sufficient height to protect the animals in the facility and keep unwanted animals
out. To be corrected by June 27, 2025.

A serval and a caracal housed in adjacent enclosures were able to interact in a negative manner which resulted in injury
and death to the serval. “Milo,” a male serval with ID# 900215005286576, was injured by a caracal housed in an adjacent
enclosure. The serval died on May 9, 2025 during treatment by a veterinarian to address the injury as was relayed to me
by a facility representative. Incompatible animals that are housed adjacent to each other may result in discomfort or injury
to the animals. Animals shall not be housed near animals that interfere with their health or cause them discomfort. To be
corrected from this time forward – May 30, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The three outdoor areas of the sheltered housing facility for five adult cats have an overgrowth of weeds throughout the 
areas. The weeds are tall and thick enough to make it difficult to see the cats when they walk through the area. 
Overgrowth of weeds may obscure the outdoor surfaces making it difficult to identify areas that need to be cleaned and 
may allow harborage for insects and pests. Housing facilities must be free of any accumulation of trash, waste material, 
junk, weeds, and other discarded material. To be corrected by June 13, 2025. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
A primary enclosure containing two kangaroos, and two wallabies is not enclosed with a perimeter fence. A perimeter 
fence is essential for restricting contact between exotic animals and unauthorized people or animals. A perimeter fence 
also acts as a secondary containment system in the event an animal escapes from the primary enclosure. The licensee 
must provide a perimeter fence that is of sufficient height to protect the animals in the facility and keep unwanted animals 
out. To be corrected by June 27, 2025. 
3.133  Critical
   
Separation. 
A serval and a caracal housed in adjacent enclosures were able to interact in a negative manner which resulted in injury 
and death to the serval. “Milo,” a male serval with ID# 900215005286576, was injured by a caracal housed in an adjacent 
enclosure. The serval died on May 9, 2025 during treatment by a veterinarian to address the injury as was relayed to me 
by a facility representative. Incompatible animals that are housed adjacent to each other may result in discomfort or injury 
to the animals. Animals shall not be housed near animals that interfere with their health or cause them discomfort. To be 
corrected from this time forward – May 30, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
